#Medical
##CPR - Remove their mask. - Click on a patient to attempt CPR. - Doing this once every 7 seconds will lower their oxygen damage. - This will also slightly extend the period of which bodies can be revived each time.
##Treating {wounds} - When a marine takes damage, they will recieve treatable wounds. - Untreated wounds are indicated by [bold]"{ }"[/bold] around their damage numbers. - When wounds are treated, the marine will begin to passively heal, very slowly. - Treating wounds will also stop any bleeding. - Using medicine will speed up damage healing. - [textlink="Medicines" link="RMCMedicine"]
##Items that treat {wounds} - Trauma and burn kits will treat all wounds when used, and provide minor bonus healing. - Surgical line and synth graft will treat some wounds each time used, with some healing each use. - Gauze and ointment will treat all wounds when used, but only ointment provides minor bonus healing. - Surgical line and synth graft can still be used after applying a trauma or burn kit.
\n
##Blood and bloodloss - When a marine has a low blood level, they will begin to take oxygen damage. - To replenish blood, use blood packs. - They can be inserted into a patient by hand, or injected by an IV. - To use a blood pack in hand, click it on the patient. - Click the patient again to remove the injector. - To use an IV, insert the bag, then drag the IV sprite over the patient. - Click the IV to remove the IV from the patient.
\n
##Defibs - Defibs can be used to revive a marine below 200 damage. - Epinephrine can be used to heal a marine when they are defibbed.
\n
##Surgery - To begin surgery, use a surgical tool on the patient. - Select a body part to work on, then follow the steps of your chosen surgery. - For larva removal, ensure you are a trained doctor and not a nurse or corpsman. - Place the patient on an operating table, then begin the operation.
\n
